required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diagnostic Value of Coronary Angiography-Derived Index of Microvascular Resistance in INOCA Patients (FlashIII)
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Multi-center Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Effectiveness and Safety of Coronary Angiography-Derived Index of Microvascular Resistance Measured Online by a Coronary Functional Measurement System

brief_summary.textblock: More than 50% of patients with stable or unstable angina pectoris have no obstructive coronary arteries by angiographic visual estimation, in which coronary microvascular dysfunction (CMD) is one of the causes of myocardial ischemia and chest pain. A coronary angiography-derived index of microvascular resistance (caIMR) is proposed for physiological assessment of microvascular diseases in coronary circulation. The aim of the trial is to assess diagnostic performance of caIMR in INOCA patients, using wire-derived index of microvascular resistance (IMR) as the reference standard.

detailed_description.textblock:
More than 50% of patients with stable or unstable angina pectoris have no obstructive coronary arteries by angiographic visual estimation, in which coronary microvascular dysfunction (CMD) is one of the causes of myocardial ischemia and chest pain. Presently, the index of microvascular resistance (IMR) measured by the pressure wire is recognized as standard for evaluating coronary microcirculatory function. A coronary angiography-derived index of microvascular resistance (caIMR) is proposed for physiological assessment of microvascular diseases in coronary circulation without pressure wire, hyperemic agents, or thermodilution method.
This study is a prospective, multi-center clinical trial. In the study, IMR (measured by pressure wire) will be used as a reference standard to evaluate the feasibility, accuracy and safety of caIMR measured by a non-invasive diagnosis system (FM21a) based on angiography images and aortic pressure wave. 116 INOCA patients will be enrolled in the study. Both IMR and caIMR measurement will be performed in the same patient in a random order after angiography. The definitions of IMR and caIMR for coronary microcirculatory ischemia are IMR≥25 and caIMR≥25. The primary endpoint is the diagnostic accuracy of caIMR. The secondary endpoint is caIMR's sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value, negative predictive value, ROC curve and AUC of caIMR diagnosis, and the diagnostic characteristics of caIMR at the vascular level.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 7 months.
primary_outcome.description: To compare diagnostic accuracy of caIMR for coronary microcirculatory lesions with IMR as control.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value, and negative predictive value
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 7 months.
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the diagnostic performance between caIMR and IMR in the patient level, with IMR as the reference standard.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 7 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Using IMR as reference standard, draw the ROC curve of caIMR. The definition of ischemia is IMR≥25.

secondary_outcome.measure: Diagnostic performance on the vessel level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 7 months.
secondary_outcome.description: The diagnostic features of caIMR compared with IMR on the vessel level.

arm_group.description: In this group, IMR based on pressure wire and arterial physiological detector will be measured first, and then caIMR base on angiography images and pressure sensor will be measured secondly.
In this group, caIMR based on angiography images and pressure sensor will be measured first, and then IMR based on pressure wire and arterial physiological detector will be measured secondly.

intervention.description: caIMR will be measured by pressure sensors which are produced by Suzhou Rainmed Medical Technology Co., Ltd. caIMR is calculated based on angiography images and Hyperemic Pa estimated from resting Pa according to prespecified equation.

intervention.intervention_name: Pressure wire-based Index of Microcirculatory Resistance
intervention.description: IMR will be measured by thermodilution method with pressure wire and arterial physiological detector which are produced by St. Jude Medical. IMR = Pd ∙Tmn

study_pop.textblock: Patients with stable or unstable angina, or suspected myocardial ischemia.
